texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 2.47
texts.text: You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but not to the fruits of action. Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, and never be attached to not doing your duty.
texts.content: You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but not to the fruits of action. Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, and never be attached to not doing your duty.
texts.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 2.48
texts.text: Perform your duty equipoised, O Arjuna, abandoning all attachment to success or failure. Such equanimity is called yoga.
texts.content: Perform your duty equipoised, O Arjuna, abandoning all attachment to success or failure. Such equanimity is called yoga.
texts.sanskrit: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय। सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 2.70
texts.text: One who is not disturbed by the incessant flow of desires can alone achieve peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy such desires.
texts.content: One who is not disturbed by the incessant flow of desires can alone achieve peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy such desires.
texts.sanskrit: आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत्। तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 3.35
texts.text: It is better to engage in one's own occupation, even though one may perform it imperfectly, than to accept another's occupation and perform it perfectly.
texts.content: It is better to engage in one's own occupation, even though one may perform it imperfectly, than to accept another's occupation and perform it perfectly.
texts.sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात्। स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 3.5
texts.text: All living entities are forced to act helplessly according to the qualities they have acquired from the modes of material nature; therefore no one can refrain from doing something, not even for a moment.
texts.content: All living entities are forced to act helplessly according to the qualities they have acquired from the modes of material nature; therefore no one can refrain from doing something, not even for a moment.
texts.sanskrit: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत्। कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 4.7
texts.text: Whenever and wherever there is a decline in religious practice, O descendant of Bharata, and a predominant rise of irreligion—at that time I descend Myself.
texts.content: Whenever and wherever there is a decline in religious practice, O descendant of Bharata, and a predominant rise of irreligion—at that time I descend Myself.
texts.sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत। अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम्॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 4.8
texts.text: To deliver the pious and to annihilate the miscreants, as well as to reestablish the principles of religion, I Myself appear, millennium after millennium.
texts.content: To deliver the pious and to annihilate the miscreants, as well as to reestablish the principles of religion, I Myself appear, millennium after millennium.
texts.sanskrit: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम्। धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 6.19
texts.text: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
texts.content: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
texts.sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता। योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 6.6
texts.text: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; but for one who has failed to do so, his very mind will be the greatest enemy.
texts.content: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; but for one who has failed to do so, his very mind will be the greatest enemy.
texts.sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः। अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्ते तात्मैव शत्रुवत्॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 7.3
texts.text: Among thousands of persons, hardly one strives for perfection, and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.
texts.content: Among thousands of persons, hardly one strives for perfection, and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.
texts.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये। यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः॥

texts.title: Bhagavad Gita 18.66
texts.text: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
texts.content: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
texts.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥

texts.title: Chandogya Upanishad 6.8.7
texts.text: That which is the finest essence—this whole world has that as its soul. That is Reality. That is Atman. That art thou.
texts.content: That which is the finest essence—this whole world has that as its soul. That is Reality. That is Atman. That art thou.

texts.title: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 1.3.28
texts.text: Lead me from the unreal to the real. Lead me from darkness to light. Lead me from death to immortality.
texts.content: Lead me from the unreal to the real. Lead me from darkness to light. Lead me from death to immortality.
texts.sanskrit: असतो मा सद्गमय। तमसो मा ज्योतिर्गमय। मृत्योर्मा अमृतं गमय॥

texts.title: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 1.4.10
texts.text: I am Brahman. This is the great statement of the Upanishads.
texts.content: I am Brahman. This is the great statement of the Upanishads.

texts.title: Spiritual Guidance
texts.text: To overcome anxiety and worry, practice living in the present moment. Surrender your concerns to the Divine and focus on performing your duties with devotion.
texts.content: To overcome anxiety and worry, practice living in the present moment. Surrender your concerns to the Divine and focus on performing your duties with devotion.

texts.title: Spiritual Guidance
texts.text: True success comes not from achieving material goals, but from aligning your actions with your dharma and serving others with a pure heart.
texts.content: True success comes not from achieving material goals, but from aligning your actions with your dharma and serving others with a pure heart.

texts.title: Spiritual Guidance
texts.text: In relationships, practice compassion and understanding. See the divine spark in every person and respond with love rather than judgment.
texts.content: In relationships, practice compassion and understanding. See the divine spark in every person and respond with love rather than judgment.

texts.title: Spiritual Guidance
texts.text: When facing difficult decisions, quiet your mind through meditation, seek wisdom from sacred texts, and listen to your inner voice of dharma.
texts.content: When facing difficult decisions, quiet your mind through meditation, seek wisdom from sacred texts, and listen to your inner voice of dharma.

texts.title: Spiritual Guidance
texts.text: Begin each day with gratitude, dedicate your work as service to the Divine, and end with reflection on how you can better serve others.
texts.content: Begin each day with gratitude, dedicate your work as service to the Divine, and end with reflection on how you can better serve others.
